website_summaries.verdict: A versatile machine with multiple blades and slicing styles. The best spiral slicing tool on the market.
cons: Requires physical coordination for successful use
Some concerns about stability of suction cups

website_summaries.verdict: For an excellent price you get an appliance that can spiralize just about anything. Great way to cut down on carbs.
pros: Multiple blades make it easy to spiralize anything from zucchini noodles to apple spirals (perfect for dehydrating into a healthy snack)
cons: We wish it was a little heavier to improve stability

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Complaint is that there is not built in ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Complaint is that there is not built in storage for the extra blades. So, it does not fit compactly into the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: angelmade

customer_reviews.title: As great as it seems!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited, but reaaaally skeptical of the Spiralizer. I really wanted it to work, but have been burned over the years from other companies selling produce slicers, etc. I am newly vegan, so I wanted something to make noodles from vegetables. I gotta say, it's just as great as it advertises! It made beautiful noodles from my squash. It's nice and sturdy, and super easy to clean. LOVE IT! Super easy to use, too. Will be using this all the time. I highly recommend it. I sent a message to customer service to let them know how much I loved the product, and they sent back very nice and personal reply. Great experience overall!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: OK - But Results not as I had expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not as excited about it as I expected to be. The results were not as I had seen from meals eaten out. It is sitting on the shelf for a few months now. Maybe might use it more in the summer for salads. Quality of materials seems good. Easy to clean. Just not inspired to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, handle is cheap plastic that will break on zucchini. Broke second time I used it, that sux, of course I can’t return it now because it’s been a lil over thirty days. Amazon is cool for shipping, but thinking I should go back to stores that back their products, so I don’t end up wasting money.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle J

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been thinking about getting a Spiralizer for awhile now, but finally took the plunge and ordered the Spiralizer® Tri-Blade Vegetable Spiral Slicer, and it is AWESOME! I made a delicious Zucchini Shrimp Scampi for dinner last night that was a much healthier alternative to the pasta version but just as delicious! I love the different blades that are included and cleanup was a breeze. I can't wait to try out more delicious (and easy) recipes with my new Spiralizer!
customer_reviews.author: ChristieL.

customer_reviews.title: 2 types of blades not included
customer_reviews.text: Well, I just received my item several days ago. I was so excited that I can make something quick and yummy... However, I realized that pack with 2 types of blades does not included, and box was inaccuraly taped around (basically, looked that someone possibly took off those 2 blades and returned this item). People, be aware about each part of your order!
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Lethal!  Don't let kids use this!
customer_reviews.text: Total junk that I am sorry I did not return when I could. The suction cups don't work and it slides all over the place while using and is quite dangerous. I have to have it pressed up against the wall of my counter when using, and that is still iffy as it can still slide. Veggies sometimes twist off the part that hold them into place (wheel with spike that you turn). It does slice things well. I will give it that, but it's just not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Craigery

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I found this very difficult to use, it moves around even with the suction cup when you are trying to use it. It was hard to get the veggies to spiral, most of the pieces were very short. It comes with a ton of attachments you have to figure out where you are going to store. Over all, using this was such a hassle I only have used it twice in the two years I have owned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how much I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I can't stop selling this to my kids! Bowl of zucchini spagettie steamed in lite coconut milk with red pepper. OMG. I LOVE THIS THING!! I feel like a TV spokes person but how did I eat before this??? Nothing is safe from being spiraled in my kitchen. I buy typically expensive cookware and visit high end kitchen shops. This inexpensive item truly is my new favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: St. Augustine Fl

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: This was a complete waste of money. I bought the spiralizer expecting to use it with zuchini, however, the size squash that is sold in stores is way too small to use in this gadget. It will only work with the huge squash that are mostly seeds inside. I bought zuchini several times, looking for the biggest ones in the bin but they were always too small to be used. Perhaps if a person grew their own, you could let it get big enough to use the machine, but that is out of the question for me.
customer_reviews.author: ARO

customer_reviews.title: This device is LARGE
customer_reviews.text: For a kitchen appliance that does one job, this spiralizer is LARGE and takes up a lot of space. Particularly, because one can now purchase spiralized vegetables at the grocery store, there is no reason to take up so much kitchen storage real estate. I haven't even removed from box...will give away to first interested cook. To return the item would have cost more than one third purchase cost.**** UPDATE****: Changing rating to 3 stars because I tried this spiralizer with sweet potatoes and it worked easily without jamming. The suction cups kept the spiralizer anchored to the counter. If this item wasn't so large, I would really like it. No one wanted to take it off my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Tabicake

customer_reviews.title: This thing ROCKS! Best thing I've ever discovered.
customer_reviews.text: I'm literally in LOVE with this thing. I've had it for just over a week and I can't get enough of it. It comes with everything listed as described. The blade cartridges are sharp and do exactly what they're supposed to. Extremely user friendly and easy to clean. It's ready to go out of the box. You get a really nice welcome email from the manufacturer that comes with a pdf attachment of the user manual and a small recipe book of fun little dishes to start trying. Children love it, and has become a very fun way to implement more veggies in to your diet. All for under $30. Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: NessaGee

customer_reviews.title: I can't stop using my Spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: I've turned into one of those people who keep taking pictures of my food and putting it on Facebook! I'm making so many fun and healthy things... And it couldn't be easier! Curly Sweet Potato Fries, yellow zucchini noodles, potato au gratin, cucumber salad! I got my parents to buy one too! This weekend my dad and I are going to make pickled beets and we're going to spiral cut them first! YUM! LDyer
customer_reviews.author: Lanette D

customer_reviews.title: Turn by hand for TRUE noodles
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good product. If you want noodles we found out my husband had to turn it by hand ..... this was a HOT mess and I think if you’re gonna buy one just spend the little bit extra and get one that suctions and actually turns on it’s on and makes noodles So sad and we are stuck now 😭
customer_reviews.author: Beauty L.

customer_reviews.title: but the kids love them! After a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Seriously worth the extra money. I have only used it to make zucchini noodles, but the kids love them! After a few uses, it totally beats buying pre made noodles. The best part is that its dishwasher safe, making cleanup a breeze. I look forward to trying a potato...
customer_reviews.author: The Allergy Chef

customer_reviews.title: Sweet potato Curly Fries at last!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've made sweet potato curly fries and zucchini noodles - and it was super fast andeasy. Just cut off the tips so you have flat edges and fix into the spiralizer and crank away! I dropped one star because I noticed that while the suction pads at the bottom kept the spiralizer from flying away it did not fix it in place so that it kept sliding across the table surface as I pushed the vegatables through the blades so that I had to use one hand to keep the spiralizer in place while cranking with the other. Not really very difficult for me but just something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: T. John

customer_reviews.title: Only Cuts Razor Thin Slices
customer_reviews.text: I found the pictures of what this does to be inaccurate. Since none of the blades are adjustable, everything you cut with this machine is almost razor thin. If you want to make chips, or want thicker slices buy an adjustable spirializer. When I called the company to complain, they were great. They sent me a new blade at no charge. Unfortunately the blade didn't fit. It was for a different model.. I called again. They recommend I return mine and get an adjustable unit from another company. That was great advice. I returned my 5 blade Spirializer and purchased an adjustable model. From my perspective an adjustable unit is the ONLY way to go.
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Awkward for me
customer_reviews.text: I could not make it work on very firm vegetables like carrots. It requires that you push the veggie into the cutter with your left hand while turning the blade crank with your right. Pushing hard enough to get the veggie against the blade often made the suction feet pop loose. If the item were a bit more heavy duty, I think it would work better. Also, it works best if you have very straight vegetables of a certain diameter. If the veggie is a crook neck squash, well, not much luck with that. It works best if you have two people, one to turn crank, one to push the veggie through.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hobb

customer_reviews.title: One thing very annoying is that when I called "customer service" and asked ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this mainly for veggie spaghetti and it's OK. It's a bit clumsy and awkward to use but I get "noodles" out of it. One thing very annoying is that when I called "customer service" and asked for my "free" spiral slicer, I was told "we discontinued that offer." Well, there was nothing in print to that effect on and in the packaging. Thanks for nothing. If you are interested in a device like this, please choose another like the one OXO makes or one better than the tri-blade vegetable spiral slicer.
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: I have used many other spiralizers from the hand held turn ones to even more expensive ones and this one surpases my expectations and quality by far over those. The feet keep it from moving perfectly, never have an issue with it. The cuts are perfect...they do exactly what each blade is supposed to. To have 5 blades is great too. Exchanging each blade is so easy to do with no problems whatsoever. Clean up is a snap, all I have to do is rinse it under water. This product far and exceeds every expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my kitchen in a while
customer_reviews.text: I was rewarding a recent lifestyle change with a new kitchen tool and picked this Spiralizer. I picked this mostly based on the previous numerous reviews. And I'm glad I did. Thank you to all of you who provide input on products on Amazon.com. I look forward to using this every week, if not daily. It has great staying power on my countertop and I feel it is safe to use. I worry about keeping it clean and my 3 rating only reflects that "emotion" if you will. I'm sure I will get along ok. I'm a fan of everything getting sterile in the dishwasher, but not sure I should do that with this item.
customer_reviews.author: ajobean

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy zoodles
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews of different zoodle makers prior to purchasing this machine. As others have noted, yes, cleaning it is challenging. Since you cannot take some of the pieces apart your only choice is to wipe the entire machine down. Storing it is also an issue in tiny kitchens like mine because it comes with more attachments than there are places to store them on the machine. The pros definitely outweigh the cons here though because this machine is ridiculously easy to use. I was able to spin the handle myself and successfully make zoodles a week after having a lumpectomy. It actually requires surprisingly little strength/force to spiral cut zucchini and squash with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Kaden

customer_reviews.title: Very Difficult To Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this due to the amount of great reviews of the product. To my disappointment, this was not easy to use. When I used it, the unit would not stay in place as it slide as I tried to use it. You have to put pressure on the handle as you turn it so I could not avoid this. Also when I put my root vegetable on the plastic prongs to hold it, it continue to slip and not hold in place. I retuned the item to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: William A Kelley

customer_reviews.title: A KEEPER!
customer_reviews.text: I love potato chips, root chips but not the deep fried grease they are immersed in for cooking. I tried many kinds of slicers with no success to cut sweet potatoes and beets thin enough so they can be cooked in a regular oven at 400 degrees. The Spiralizer 5-Blade Vegetable Slicer was THE FIRST slicer that cut these vegetables thin enough to make chips sprinkled in olive oil. While my first experiment resulted in burnt chips, all I have to do now is to lesson the cooking time. I will keep the Spiralizer ( 5-Blade Vegetable Slicer) and experiment with the other blades next.
customer_reviews.author: CLP Review

customer_reviews.title: What a waste...
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely hard to use and even worse to clean. not all of the suction sups would sick so the whole machine slid or a single side started to slide. Items fell off of the ledge. Trying to hold it steady, push the vegetable forward and turn the crank was almost impossible. Cleaning was difficult, all those closed and tight plastic pieces. No thank you - cutting with a knife would be easier, it's going back I cannot speak to the quality, durability or versatility that's why 3 stars were given for each.
customer_reviews.author: T. Paddy

customer_reviews.title: Does not adhere to any surface - will be returning
customer_reviews.text: The blades on this spiralizer cut very well on all of the vegetables that I tried. However, the suction cups do not adhere to the surface, it just slides around while you are using it. I tried it on my clean counter top as well as the stove surface. I tried it dry, tried with just a drop of water (hoping to create a seal) and nothing worked. It made for some very frustrating spiralizing! I hate that I have to return it because if it would have adhered to the surface, it would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and quick to use, and made well formed noodles. I give it five stars for the great job it does, but I do have two minor complaints: - It comes with stickers over the blades for protection, but even though I was careful, they were positioned so that in taking one off I cut myself pretty bad. No issues with actual use or cleaning, as the sticker removal was the only thing that brought my hands near the blade edge. - There is no storage for several of the blades, and they’re WAY too sharp and dangerous to store loose in a drawer or cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Seoh

customer_reviews.title: High quality, easy care, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to set up, make my spirals and clean up. Changing blades is a breeze. Didn’t even have to read the instructions. I just started a low-carb diet so now I won’t have to give up my Italian dishes. The night I tried this for the first time we gorged on zucchini. Took me three tries to get it right. You need to get lots of water out before cooking the zucchini. I finally ended up rolling it in a cotton towel. Got it dry enough to sauté fry. Don’t overdo the salt when extracting water. You’d think it would rinse off but it gets absorbed. Have fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wooly Bully

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.  One of my favorite kitchen tools now.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after coming across recipes online for spiralized veggies. Can't believe it took me so long to get on board with this healthy trend. I love it. This works great, very solid, good blade selection although now I see they come with even more blades for the same price. It's easy to clean and store. You can knock out a sweet potato, carrot, beet or zuchinni in less than a minute from wash and prep to spiralize. Cleanup takes a couple minutes. I've probably tried a dozen different recipes now and all have been fantastic. Almost beats out my Vitamix blender as my favorite kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Feet suction cups don't work
customer_reviews.text: the suction cups on the "feet" do not hold. It slides around when I try to use it. This means I need someone to hold it for me to use it. This is so sad because I used to have one that worked and I loved it. I complained to the company and they sent me new suction cup "feet". But they are exactly the same as the ones that came with it and do not work any better. My old one had a longer base and held. The newer redesign just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: The blue tape does not come all the way off
customer_reviews.text: Poor packaging. Do you suppose they place the impossible to get off blue tape over the blades strategically So you are almost guaranteed to slice your hand open trying to get it off? Even after pulling the tape off there’s still plenty of blue tape residue left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Would like to utilize it more!
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of such an item until I purchased a Keto diet book. I wondered just how much I would use it to justify the purchase. I have used it for zoodles and sliced potatoes. It is rugged, cleans up easily,and the rubber suction cups hold it in place. I would love to have had instructions for the many blades included. There are mm measurements on each blade, but no instruction on what they are for. I'm sure I'm not utilizing it nearly as much as I could .
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hoppes

customer_reviews.title: my favorite kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: While zoodles are fun, spiralizing a combination of sweet potatoes, parsnips and onions is hard to beat. The ribbon blade is also a great way to change up a salad. My only complaint is that the suction isn't really all that good and the white plastic stains easily, especially with sweet potatoes and beets. Still a great gadget to make veggies more interesting without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: Chica Loca

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Compact, and does a great job.  Very pleased with this Spiralizer
customer_reviews.text: Love this. The design on this spiralizer is great for storage, the different blades fit into slots of the spiralizer itself with a convenient container to hold two extra blades. The suction cups on the bottom hold very well on the counter top. It is fast and easy. I just received his and have done zucchini which was Perfect and because of the mention of carrots I had a few large ones that I experimented with and they worked well. I can’t wait to experiment with more. If you have been thinking of getting a spiralizer but were not sure of the quality of the affordable ones that are available, this one is for you.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use product!
customer_reviews.text: First time user and I am hooked. Product set up is simple and instructions easy. Being carb conscience, I mainly bought this to spiralize zucchini for traditional pasta dishes. It worked perfectly and I was able to set up the product, read instructions and spiralize 6 zucchini squash in about 5 minutes. I bought this as a lightning deal after purchasing already spiralized zucchini at the grocery store that I thought were expensive but wanted to try. This product is well worth the price and I plan to use often to provide a healthy alternative for traditional pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Potential danger for serious injury
customer_reviews.text: After normal use the metal pin is not too be found. It has come off the plastic and may have gone into the spiralized vegetable. Not sure but it potentially could have been swallowed. Can't get the blade replaced either,
customer_reviews.author: Zalmi

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Made zucchini noodles, turned out well. Would advise using the LARGEST noodle blade for these IF using large zucchini, medium blade if medium zucchini as they do compress. If you place them in a colander, sprinkle them with 1 Tablespoon of Kosher salt, let sit for 20 minutes, press out liquid, you can then place in baggies and freeze. These make wonderful "zoodle" dishes in place of pastas. Can't wait to try it on other veggies.
customer_reviews.author: B. D

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We received the spiralizer yesterday. I've been watching carbs and thought I'd give "zoodles" from zucchini a try. The pre-cut ones at the store are ridiculously expensive for what they are. We received all 5 blades as promised, one in the spiralizer, two in the storage underneath and two in a separate package. Following the instructions, I pressed down firmly to make sure the suction cups would get a good grip. Using the spaghetti blade the "zoodles" came out perfectly and with almost no effort. It works really well.
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I got this a couple hours ago and I'm so in love. I cant stop lololol. I am super impressed with the suction power to hold it to the counter - this thing doesnt move. I cleaned all the parts right away, and since its plastic and stainless, it cleans up easily. I'll let you know what happens with cleaning after I finish going to town with it today. The cuts are really great, too, and I'm pleased with the variety of pieces. Its plastic so it's not the highest end, but for home use and using it for variety, it works GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: OneAmongMany

customer_reviews.title: The five stages of grief
customer_reviews.text: When my fiancee said she was ordering a veggie spiralizer, I went through several emotional stages. First, I felt confusion. What is a spiralizer, and why do my vegetables need to be spiralized? Second was disgust. Great, now that she's got a new kitchen toy that involves veggies, she's going to try and make me eat more vegetables. Third was amusement. What other food items can I make into delightful little spirals with this? Fourth was annoyance as I had to untangle my ravaged T-Bone steak from this appliance. Finally, I reached the acceptance stage. As long as I'm going to be forced to eat vegetables, they might as well be in weird little connected circles. At that, it excels.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype...
customer_reviews.text: I'm skeptical of kitchen gadgets when you get fancier that a potato peeler, but I gave Spiralizer a shot. So glad I did, it's wonderful. There's really no learning curve, and I was able to make perfect zoodles and sweet potato curly fries on the first attempt. We're on one of those wacky diets right now, but it allows all the veggies and protein you can handle, so this is a godsend. It seems sturdy, and well thought out. I'm using it almost every other day now, so eventually I WILL wear it out, and I would order a new one immediately. I wouldn't want to be without it - great product at an extremely reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Nikon User

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Spiralizer less than 2 days ago, so I've only used it once to make zoodles. Worked perfectly. I had only used a vegetinni in the past and this is so much easier and quicker. The only drawback that I can mention is that there isn't a spot to store all five of the blades. You can keep three in the machine but the other two (which come in a little packet) will need to be kept elsewhere. I'm just storing my three preferred blades in the machine. Other than that small criticism, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: BeejinPA

customer_reviews.title: Decent product & price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first veggie spiral slicing product, so I do not have first hand knowledge of how others work, but this one is ok for it's purpose. I have only used 2 different blades to cut zuchinni and one of them makes the spirals too big, so I pretty much only use 1 blade. The unit suction cups to the surface which is good, but it slides along my countertop and I have to constantly readjust it while using the problem. Not a major problem but something that is noticeable for me. I'm interested in trying it with other veggies but I've fallen in love with veggie spaghetti made from this spiralizer!
customer_reviews.author: Online Diva

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product a few times since I have purchased it and we love it! It is very convenient to just pull out of the cupboard and put to use. The directions were simple and I was impressed on well it shredded all of my over sized vegetables from the garden. I do have to adjust the suction after every couple of veggies, but that's not an issue. For the price, this product has been a life savor!
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This spiralizer is a super addition to any kitchen. The packaging is great. The parts are all food grade plastic, with brass inserts where the handle screws together. The blades are stainless steel, and there is a convenient holder for the extra blades. The operation of the spiralizer is easy and the end product is uniform and ready to cook with, or to add to a salad. The price is very reasonable. I am very happy with this slicer, and highly recommend it if you are looking to buy one. I think it is the best you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: A must for low carb cooks in search of a pasta replacement.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this purely to make zucchini noodles. We were leaning towards the more expensive Kitchen Aid attachment, but after reading reviews and considering how often we would use it, we went with this. We have been delighted with this product and would recommended it highly to anyone else. My wife had played withe a few other attachments, mostly with zucchini and and cucumbers, and all have worked perfectly. The only negative is the suction. It will not stay put on our granite counter tops. However, if you place a hand under the spinning fruit you can easily hold it in place and quickly get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: TBoneJPH

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had my new gadget for a couple of months. I tried other spiralizers in the past, but nothing like this one. This is bigger than the others, but my fingers are safer. I am not scared anymore of cutting my fingers. Besides, i can spirralize the veggies up to the very end. With others I was so scared of cutting myself, that I had to chop the last end with a knife. It is easier to clean than I thought. I make my salads faster than before, and my dishes look very festive. Some times I think that I am going to use the "cucumber garland' to decorate my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Yilda A. Ruiz-monroy

customer_reviews.title: Makes the noodles just like whole foods! SAVE $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: Although this sucker is made of plastic, it still gets the job done. My only complaint is that the blades are a bit difficult to clean by hand, and your dishwasher might not catch all the little gunk that gets stuck in there. Also, it tells you to cut all your vegetables in half before putting them on the spiralizer but small to medium sized vegetables fit no problem. If you do this you save a little bit of the vegetable since you get to spiralize the end of the half you would have lost. BUY THIS and maket it yourself instead of buying a measly 8 oz bag from whole foods for 8 dollars of your hard earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use spiralizer for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This spiralizer is easy to use and it comes with a good set of different blades for different types of cuts. I mostly use it to make "zoodles," but have also used it to make "julienned" carrots/matchstick carrots (spiralize and then cut with scissors) for noodles salads and slaws. The spiralizer turns easily and clean-up for the blades and the main stand is also easy. It comes with a storage container (with a lid) to catch the spiralized veggies. The spiralizer stand has 4 suction cups to help hold it down on your counter. There is some slippage when pushing the spiralizer handle forward, but it's easy to reposition so it's not a dealbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: sprockets

customer_reviews.title: We found the Spiralizer very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We used the Spiralizer with different vegetables, such as soft (zucchini), and harder ones (yams and butternut squash). We found the Spiralizer very easy to use, and had no surprises between what was advertised and specified on the Amazon page, along with what we actually encountered. The blades are really very sharp and able to cut everything very smoothly. Also, although it's a small and light utensil, thanks to its suction cups in the base it is very stable and doesn't move when being used. The only thing is that the blade frame became colored when cutting the yams, and is still a bit stained after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a year, and it works flawlessly. I was concerned because it is all plastic, and has a cheap feel. If you are gentle with it, I assume it will last for years. I would prefer one made of a metal. However, for the price, you cannot beat this. It is also versatile. I have prepared meals with it that our company rave over.
customer_reviews.author: CoachDave

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love my spiralizer! I've had this thing for about a year or so. For the price, it works wonders. The suction cups do move a bit and you have to re position them every so often, but that's a minor detail that isn't a big deal. It does stain easily because it's white, but you just have to keep up with giving it a good scrub. I use this to make zucchini noodles and even make curly fries from sweet potato. Best thing I have purchased on amazon!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: This bad boy is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: So versatile and easy to use! Clean up sucks but that’s normal for the job it’s doing. We spiralized onions and then cooked them with spiralized potatoes and it was amazing! We spiralized bell peppers and put them on sandwiches with nutritional yeast, vegan mayo and vegan cheese and they were great! Potatoes and sweet potatoes make awesome fries! Only failure so far was tomatoes- not so good but that one was a dumb idea.. Really most veggies spiralize and it makes for a lot of fun for our toddler come dinner time!
customer_reviews.author: Rownus

customer_reviews.title: Zoodles!
customer_reviews.text: The suction on this needs to be stronger, especially since marble is slippery so the appliance just slides across the countertop. Don’t cut the ends off both sides of the zucchini cuz the center of a zucchini is mush (seeds) so the press just grinds through the center instead of pressing it into the blade. Leave the non-blade end of the zucchini intact. Barring these things, and including some dexterous finagling during operation, it’s delightful for our household diabetic to have a noodle alternative with an abundant vegetable.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This thing works for what is intended almost perfectly, reason why Im not giving it 5 stars its because the “curly fries” blade dies not make curly fries it cute the potatoes too flat so its more like a curly noodle, think of the thickness of fettuccine, maybe a little but more thick, definitely not curly fries it was quite disappointing when planning a fun burgers and curly fries night and Not having the expected result... for the rest of the blades they work like a charm, great on zuchini and carrots
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Gomez

customer_reviews.title: What Are You Waiting For?
customer_reviews.text: My friends had told me about spiralizing your veggies, but until I bought this Spiralizer I didn't know how easy it was. I was nervous at first to try and use the Spiralizer; however, after I watched a few videos on You Tube, I felt confident to try out my purchase. I didn't think the suction power was adequate, but maybe it was because I was trying to use the product on a tile surface. Other than the Spiralizer moving around a little bit, I felt like my initial time of using this product was a positive experience. Amazon mentions some e-books that are available with this product. I did not find that in my shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke second time I used it. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke second time I used it. I am a lightweight person so it's not from too much pull on it. Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, with one exception
customer_reviews.text: As soon as the spiralizer arrived, it was put to use. Too many zucchini from our garden! Setup instructions were very easy. Using it was very easy and quick. It zipped through the zucchini in a short amount of time. The only thing that isn't quite up to a high level of quality are the suction cups. As hard as we tried on multiple services (wood, granite, quartz), the tool kept slipping. One of us had to hold onto it while the other used the crank. Despite that, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DMAN1115

customer_reviews.title: Good except for one detail!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It is easy to use and does a good job in total. It is also easy to clean. One critique I have, which has kept me from giving this product five stars, is that the suction/grip at the bottom does not work properly. The machine kept sliding forward, which meant I had to hold it down with one hand then pause to shift the zucchini forward. I’m not sure if this is a problem with my personal spiralizer only, but it certainly is a thing to keep in mind when purchasing this. Otherwise, this spiralizer works well :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It's completely worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review, I have to tell you I love love love the ease of use of my spiralizer. It has truly opened an avenue in an otherwise pretty boring eating ritual. I've been obsessed with my spiralizer making spaghetti and now Udon style zucchini noodles next to purchasing my juicer i feel this will help me stay on track with a healthy lifestyle and cutting down on those bad carbs. You should definitely purchase you wont regret it
customer_reviews.author: joysyear

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Use
customer_reviews.text: When did cooking become so much fun? I really enjoy spiralizing vegetables for cooking, salads, and snacks, whether it is zucchini, squash, cucumber, or sweet potato. They are easier to cook and taste so much better when spiralized. My diet has become much healthier since I received my spiralizer. It is very easy to clean. The suction cups on the legs don't really hold onto our granite counter top and I'm not sure how well the plastic parts will hold up over the long term but for now...all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Digman

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: My Gf bought one of these a couple years ago and we use the heck out of it. I am retiring and moving back to my home state and she is staying behind for a year or so. So needed one to take with me. Hers only came with 3 blades and this one has 7. They can actually interchange with each other which is a bonus as she liked some of other cutters in this one. So we split them up between us. Very useful when making salads for dinner, healthy dinners at night.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Goldammer

customer_reviews.title: Best spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 previous attempts as a spiralizer tool. None of them have worked well, or not at all. I was skeptical but thought I'd try again for the inexpensive price of this one. It's fantastic! Works with veggies and potatoes. Each blade does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: MQ

customer_reviews.title: Great selection of blades. Sturdy. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to try spiralizing and mother in law loaned us a cone shaped spiralizer. We made some zoodles, but it was a difficult process. We got this spiralizer and it makes a world of difference. Many different blades to get just the size you want and it is so fast and simple to prepare enough for everyone. Flat blade cuts cabbage in a blink of the eye. Kids love "cab"oodles. We bought another for Mom too.
customer_reviews.author: T McKenna

customer_reviews.title: tried to angel hair a cucumber but eventually the machine ...
customer_reviews.text: tried to angel hair a cucumber but eventually the machine mushed into it and it would not spin anymore, and it is big to clean, it is meant for straight vegetables...and sometimes cucumbers are curved.
customer_reviews.author: Solii

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this spiralizer! Honestly. I have to admit that when I bought it, I was prying it wouldn't become one of those things that ends up on some back shelf, all but forgotten about. But it is awesome!!! i use it at least twice a day. Who would have thought that celeriac or parsnips or zucchini spiralized could be so tasty? Do yourself a favor and try this little machine. It's simple to use and to clean. It's very reasonably priced. If you are living the paleo lifestyle, this will add so much to your meals. I can't believe it took me this long to try one. Changed my life!
customer_reviews.author: Book lover in Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Worth the counter space
customer_reviews.text: I've been making zoodles by peeling and cutting my zucchini with a hand peeler and knife. I've tried the handheld spiralizer (different brand) but it was flimsy and the zoodles were inconsistent and didn't come out right. I gave it away. When I got this Spiralizer 5-Blade Vegetable Slicer I tried the angel hair slicer on my zucchini. Easy to use and there was very little waste of the veggie and I saved so much time. I did wish there was a storage space for the two extra blades but overall, a great purchase and I'm very thankful that there this Spiralizer.
customer_reviews.author: brianchandotcom

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking cuz you found it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth spiralizer I have purchased and I have to say, the best and a little cheaper in price. I just got it this morning and have already used it for lunch and prepping for dinner. Thus is the best deal in my opinion for the price. You can stop looking now, because you have found what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Peepos

customer_reviews.title: Works great on uniformly shaped veggies, don't even bother trying curly fries. Sharp blades.
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving this 3 stars because it does NOT do curly fries very well. They are flat, mostly C-Shaped, not useful to try to make curly fries. For the spiralizer, it works great provided your veggies are uniformly circular. Odd-shaped items will not work well with this unit. Also, the little tray to store the extra slicers is great, but there isn't enough of them so you still have VERY sharp slicers laying around. Not good if you have small children around.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Not much use for hard veggies like carrots. Time will tell about the durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought it hoping to see an improvement is the design. It looks the same as the one I had that broke at the handle. O.K. for soft veggies. Not much use for hard veggies like carrots. Time will tell about the durability. The extra blades sound nice but I don't think I'd bother if I made another purchase like this.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this one!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase a spiralizer at all, but after researching both manual and electric models, I am extremely happy with my choice. This spiralizer is very easy to use and washes up beautifully. I've only experimented on raw zucchini, sweet potatoes, and turnips, but very little effort was required to spiralize them. I was a little surprised by the "core" of vegetable that is left, but I am a novice spiralizer. Giving it more thought, though, it does seem logical. When in use, it is very stable on my kitchen counter and a cinch to remove when finished. As recommended, I washed the blade portions with a brush, which made it extra-easy to clean. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Marie C. in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be very good quality, especially for the price! It did an excellent job making my spiralized zucchini. My only complaint would be one of the blades claims to be for curly fries and unfortunately it produces paper thin flat spirals which were very far from curly fries. Aside from that one attachment claiming to be for something it shouldn't, the item is of good quality. It was so easy and fun to spiralize things, easy to store and wash.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Noodles for Days
customer_reviews.text: Had "zoodles" (zucchini noodles) for the first time at a local poké shop and didn't realize that eating vegetables could be so enjoyable! Figured it'd be a lengthy process, but still ended up looking into how it was made and stumbled across the Spiralizer 5-blade Vegetable Slicer. Meal prepping for salads and healthier pasta alternatives has never been easier/faster. Not to mention, no need for purchasing inflated convenience cost store options when you can easily make it at home. Eager to explore more recipes that all the functionalities of the slicer has to offer!
customer_reviews.author: Pancho

customer_reviews.title: Great for vegetable noodles!
customer_reviews.text: As vegans, we are always looking for simple but creative ways to use vegetables in our daily cooking. The Spiralizer fits the bill! It's a great piece of gear. Want some zucchini noodles? Done in a flash. Just a couple thoughts. While it's great that you get five blades for all of your potential uses, there is only storage for three of the five blades...that could be improved. Secondly, cleanup is only rated as OK...likely depends on what you are slicing, and I get that. A caution...this is a serious kitchen tool with SHARP blades. Young children should NOT be allowed near the blade part!
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Buikema

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: At first I had trouble. I was going to return. Then I decided to try again. Glad I did because second time around it worked great. Suction is good and it doesn’t budge. . I use mine on granite. Handle to push food forward is cheap plastic and I could see it breaking with too much force, so I just push from behind the vegetable mount and don’t even use handle and it works great. Easy to clean. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Best investment you could make for a better and healthy lifestyle.
customer_reviews.text: I have been thinking about changing my eating choices for the better. However, let's be honest is easier buying them at the grocery market than actually spend time preparing it with your next meal. "I am too busy, it takes to much time, or I am not an expert on how to cook it." Those were a few of my excuses to avoid fresh veggies or any greens in my meals. This little device is pretty amazing and makes incorporating veggies into my meals also easier and cleaning a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: REDXGEAR

customer_reviews.title: It does wirk
customer_reviews.text: This product works and was purchased based upon a recommendation of a friend. It is plastic and light and needs to be used with a light hand, in other words not a shop tool. if used with a light hand it preforms fabulously. I think if care is used this product will last a long time and for the price is much better than a similar product made of metal. I would highly recommend for the home kitchen where a bit more care of appliances takes place rather than a commercial kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: lloyd f grubbe

customer_reviews.title: Hopeful
customer_reviews.text: Had to fix one of the springs on the release button as it came loose on one side after only pushing it once. It's good to go now. Been waiting 10 minutes for a response from the Free Julienne/Peeler instructions insert. Once assembled it seems like it'd be easy and straight forward to use. I'm excited to hopefully save some money on veggie pasta rather than spending a load on the prepared stuff.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeFiend

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for what I wanted. I wanted something to turn zucchini into "noodles" and the spaghetti blade is great! I keep forgetting that size matters lol but when I get the right size zucchini I get the best zoodles. I also used it to cut potatoes and its so much easier than trying to chop them with a knife. I stick the blades in my dish washer and they came out fine which is great because I hate washing dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Bishop

customer_reviews.title: It does it all!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Finally I have something that does it all. It is sturdy. It is easy to clean. The blades are super-sharp. I can even use it to make pasta. I spend a lot of time in the kitchen and this handy slicer is going to cut my prep time way down so I can spend more time with my family instead of being in the kitchen. This gadget makes making tacos a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this about an hour ago and had to try it out. Being an adult working from home due to covid this is the highlight of my month so far. I have been using a hand held one for months. My arms are tired lol. First I love the suction. It stuck to my counter top like a champ. The blades are so easy to change out and i love the little storage under for your favorite blades. So easy. I had 2 cucumbers sliced up in less than 2 minutes. Everything is nice and smooth and I'm a huge fan!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Really does the job on zucchini!
customer_reviews.text: The spiralizer was delivered very quicly. I have used to cut zoodles out of zucchini. It worked great. Would have given the purchase 5 stars but unfortunately the instructions were pretty much useless. Fortunately youtube has a number of how to use it videos which helped immensely. I wet the suction cup retainers and still the unit wandered. I could have been putting more pressure on it than required.
customer_reviews.author: mullyden

customer_reviews.title: More Veggies Pls......
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing machine. If you are trying to avoid carbs and increasing your consumption of veggies each day, this is a huge help. Zucchini spirals with tomato sauce becomes a treat. The only problem that I have had is with butternut squash - I cannot get spirals. I guess the squash is too hard for me to push along the rail while turning the crank handle. Would love to hear from someone who has achieved spirals with butternu or other hard, winter squash. However, I would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS! The ONLY con is that it is somewhat bulky and you need a flat top surface for the suctions to stick too BUT I knew that going into the purchase. You also need to make sure things are shoved on the spinner firmly and its centered for optimum slicing, if its off by even a little it wont work as good and youll have to redo. Ive made so many dishes with this and the 2 book combo I ordered. Would absolutely buy again! ive made sweet potato "rice", sweet potato carbonara and a summer zoodle salad that have been to die for! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for creating zoodles!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really enjoying this product! Took me a few times to get coordinated to turn the crank and push my vegetables through but that is operator deficiency! I got it mainly to make zoodles to replace pasta and for me it has been perfect. Have not tried on anything but zucchini so I don’t know how other veggies work. Would have been fun to have a few recommendations of recipes to try!
customer_reviews.author: Skimom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible spiralizer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this spiralizer based on the reviews. Could it actually be that good? YES, IT IS!!! I am amazed by the thoughtfulness that went into blade safety and storage, by the suction, and by how easy it is to use. I spiralized four zucchinis in a minute. I can’t wait to use it for other things. My only suggestion would be that they label the seven blades the same thing as they are called in the manual. I had to look up the blades online to find out which is which.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple sturdy and yummy
customer_reviews.text: After much research this Spiralizer checked all the boxes. I’ve been dealing with diabetes for 15 years and counting carbs and coming up with carb friendly recipes is not an easy task. More vegetables is easy to say but the same choices over and over gets boring, boring means cheating. But the Spiralizer makes boring vegetables new again. It’s not a new concept, I’ve seen it in restaurants and grocery aisles but that gets expensive. So now I can do it at home for a lot less. Thank you Spiralizer!!
customer_reviews.author: J R C

customer_reviews.title: 5 blade sprilizer
customer_reviews.text: We recently HAD to go to a low carb diet - and since my hubby and I both love zucchinni zoodles - we needed this in our lives. It works FANTASTIC! I do not know just HOW I lived until I got this! shipment was quick - little assembly to it. ~ just be careful: the blades are very very sharp! (trust me) ;) Seller was wonderful to work with - speedy - easy ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndee

customer_reviews.title: Already searching for more recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Easy to use, replace blades, clean, and store! I was pleasantly surprised by how well is noodles the squash and zucchini. Saved me a ton of time. The fact that you can disassemble is also fantastic for cleaning it. Bottom suction cups were also really affective. Spot on pricing too. The unit does take up some shelf space, which made me reluctant about buying it. But it was definitely worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen tools!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Way better than the pencil sharpener styled ones. It makes long thin strands quickly and easily. I have become addicted to zoodles!! It would be perfect if there were a cover or guard for the blades. (2 have slots underneath, the third stays in the upright position). Just be careful if you have any clumsy kitchen mates and keep it way far from kids. This really makes great zoodles though and any other veggies. I like a mix of zucchini and sweet potato noodles. (Just make sure you get some of the liquid out of the zucchini before sautéing- there are various techniques) It's so good!! This is the best one for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Excellent Results
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT when I purchase a new kitchen tool and immediately-first try- and I feel like a real chef! LOL. Seriously, this is a beautiful design of equipment. Everything is ergonomic. Wicked sharp. So easy to change blades and clean. And I did a beet salad first try. Wow. I will never slice another beet as long as I live!!! . This will help me eat more RAW! Texture truly is everything. Very happy with it. Solid machine.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: The spiralizer is very easy to operate and clean! Please note, there are 2 blades slid in beneath the unit (storage area) - that I missed! I thought only 3 blades came and that 2 were missing. However, they were stored so nicely - I didn't even know they were there! I love the spiralizer! It's easy to use and there is little to know waste of your veggies because of the way this unit is designed!
customer_reviews.author: judepdx

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use w zucchini and smaller veggies. Really like how fast you can make zoodles etc. I will say it takes two people w a butternut squash or anything heavy. Needs held down or an extra set of hands to feed it through. Think it could have come w a recipe book too. We have managed to make some really good dishes with the veggie noodles and online recipes though.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper's mom

customer_reviews.title: Storage for blades
customer_reviews.text: I think I’m going to get a lot of use from this gadget. It’s very easy to use and just as easy to clean. I’m giving it 4 out of 5 stars because it only houses 3 out of the 5 blades it comes with. The remaining 2 will inevitably end up in the back of a shelf or drawer somewhere never to be seen again. It would have been better if the makers had added additional space on the gadget itself to store them. But, it’s not a deal breaker and I would still recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hashbrown
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I was very amazed when I had my first spiralized zucchini. I sauteed it and put some spaghetti sauce on it. My family loved it. Cleaning is very easy, but use a tooth brush to clean the blades. They are sharp! I also made an instant hashbrown, my favorite! I use the angel hair blade to shred potatoes and cook it with lots of butter on a medium low frying pan. I cover the frying pan with a lid to cook it thoroughly by steam for 5 minutes, and I flip the hashbrown for 4 more minutes without the lid for crispiness. I use this spiralizer about 5 times out of 7 days. This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappoing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cutter primarily to make curly fries and spiral fried onions. The cutter works good, but the thickness of the cut for the fries and onions is too thin. The suction cups didn't stick at all, but put it up next to the cutting board to limit its movement and worked out okay. As a spiral cutter for veggies, I think it's good for the price, but if you're looking to duplicate commercial curly fries, I would try something else.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Finicky eaters will love the Spirilizer!
customer_reviews.text: We're having a lot of fun with our Spirilizer. One of my family members isn't much of a veggie eater (other than lima beans and peas), but cold japanese zoodles for lunch and chipotle spiraled sweet potato salad for dinner have got him eating more. Tonight we are having beet and gorgonzola salad. The Spiralizer is easy to hand and has a small footprint, so I just leave on the side counter. The suction cup feet stay put and it was easy to use the Spiralizer - no tough cranking. Clean up was incredibly easy. This is going to be my favorite housewarming and wedding gift to give!
customer_reviews.author: Jonquil

customer_reviews.title: Love This Spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this just to make zoodles. I have since expanded my use... I spiral cut vegetables for wraps & salads, make sweet potatoe & regular fries & I'm still experimenting! Easy to use, easy to clean. Instructions are clear. I find I don't waste vegetables anymore. I know the vegetables taste the same but using the spiralizer gives them a different texture. I would definitely recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: patricia quinlan

customer_reviews.title: The Spiralizer came highly recommended. I did a lot of researching before purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: The Spiralizer came highly recommended. I did a lot of researching before purchasing it, and I am delighted with my new kitchen tool. I know I will use it very often and it will be a great help in our eating more healthily and with a lot less work in the kitchen. It is very easy to clean and keep clean. I do spray it with an oil kitchen spray before each use and that makes it even easier to clean. I have recommended it to many people, and I know that several other people have ordered it as well. Thank you Spiralizer
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, easy to use, get healthy in 2020!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a veggie spiralizer for a while. I have been doing my research and It had alot of positive reviews, so I decided to purchase this one. It is very easy to use and clean which is something I love! The suction cups work very well to keep it in place on the counter. There are so many different blades to make multiple spirals. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: dcm2

product_meta.title: Spiralizer 5-Blade Vegetable Slicer, Strongest-and-Heaviest Spiral Slicer, Best Veggie Pasta Spaghetti Maker for Keto/Paleo/Gluten-Free, Comes with 4 Recipe Ebooks
feature_bullets: Quality above all - stronger than ever – Spiralizer is the brand people have come to trust and rely on. Our new 3rd generation model is 30-35% stronger than any of the others on the market ! Our 420 high carbon cutlery grade stainless steel blades and stronger Ultra reinforced BPA free ABS make it possible to Spiralize harder root vegetables like sweet potatoes and turnips that previously broke Spiralizer handles

Never get bored on a keto/low carb, Paleo, raw, vegan, or gluten-free diet again - start making healthy Gourmet meals as soon as you get it - you'll get an excellent recipe e-book filled with nutritious, mouth-watering meal ideas The whole family will love!

Raving fans! - our product has been seen on bethenny, Ellen, the doctors, the food Network, National newspapers and magazines throughout the country and if that's not enough, read the thousands of reviews left by amazing customers.

Why do I need This? - enjoy your meals even if you are on a diet (raw, vegan, low carb, gluten-free, no wheat, Paleo). replace high carb pasta with veggie pasta. A perfect gift for all occasions: what is better than the gift of health?
Lifetime replacement - you are covered by Spiralizer lifetime no-hassle replacement policy.
